newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Howard sees no Australia saving policy change.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Howard sees no Australia saving policy change.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said on Friday the government had not dropped plans detailed before the March election for further modest tax incentives to increase savings.
"We have not junked the very modest proposals for tax incentives for savings (given before the election)," Howard told a Liberal party function.
Howard was referring to a promise made before the March 2 election by the Liberal-National coalition to offer the low paid a lower tax rate on earnings earnt on interest.
Howard said before the election that the move would cost less than A$1 billion but more than A$100 million in lost tax revenues.
